title: When is a judgment satisfied after a bank levy?
question: I had a successful bank levy in San Diego County. Since the date that the bank levy actually "hit" (the Sheriff served the documents and the Memorandum of Garnishee was returned" I filed a Memorandum of Costs After Judgment to recoup the costs/fees associated with the bank levy.
answers: If debt has been satisfied by the levy, you would be required to the the Satisfaction of Judgment with the court.

There’s more to this than the memorandum of costs. The amount levied may be less than the amount of the judgment. The debtor may file a claim of exemption. IF the debt has been paid, with interest and costs, you will be required to file an acknowledgment of satisfaction with the court,
It sounds like you are the creditor. Contact an attorney in your area who does garnishments and see if you can get a consultation. The answer to your question depends on numerous facts.
